intro: Tricholobus ferrugineus, commonly known as the rusty tricholobus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive rusty-colored stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is native to regions in Europe and is often found in grassy habitats and along roadsides. Tricholobus ferrugineus is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
